summary: This is an email chain from August 26, 2019, between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office representative regarding securing seats for three FBI officials to attend an upcoming hearing related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Special Agent in Charge, Criminal Division
persons.context: The sender of the final email in the chain, thanking the recipient and signing off from the FBI New York Office.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI New York
persons.context: Forwarded a message regarding securing seats for an Epstein hearing, identifying themselves as from the FBI New York office.

persons.name: USANYS
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York representative
persons.context: The recipient and replier in the email chain, confirming they can secure seats for FBI officials to attend the Epstein hearing.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel in the New York office coordinating on attendance at the Epstein hearing.
FBI agent coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to secure seating for a court hearing.

events.title: Epstein Hearing
events.description: A court hearing related to Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled for the day after this email correspondence.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: The email is dated August 26, 2019, the day before a significant Epstein-related hearing.

Three high-level FBI officials from the New York office sought to attend the hearing: the Special Agent in Charge of the Criminal Division, an Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC), and a Special Agent in Charge (SAC).
The request was made to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), which confirmed it could secure the seats.
The FBI personnel involved were from Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking.
The document shows inter-agency coordination between the FBI and federal prosecutors regarding court proceedings in the Epstein case shortly before Epstein's death.
